field_edited_text.value:
Harbor Route and Related Proposals



The remaining possibility would involve a route south of the proposed
Harbor Route. For the following reasons this possibility appeared less
desirable than the Harbor Route:

a.

C.

To effect an interchange with the Southwest Expressway (which
is the continuation of Jones Falls Expressway) it would be neces-
sary to drop down at least six to eight blocks below Pratt Street,
thus losing the desirable proximity between the central business
district and the Expressway which is one of the main features of
the Harbor Route. Jurthermore, substantial property takings
would be necessary for this interchange.

Some type of harbor crossing would be necessary over the North-
west Branch which would add considerably to the cost. In
addition, there might be legal conflicts with the present Harbor
Tunnel which, in effect, would mean that this crossing could not
be constructed for a number of years. (The bonds for the Harbor
Tunnel were sold with the proviso that there would be no com-
peting harbor crossing until a certain proportion of the bonds
were retired.)

While the point was not explored, it seems probable that more
damage would be done to industrial areas by such a route than
would be the case either for the Harbor Route or the Northern
Route.

For all of these reasons a route south of the Harbor Route did not
appear desirable.

47
